label: Vehicle Diagnostics
description: Uses scan tools and test equipment to identify mechanical, electrical, and electronic faults in passenger or commercial vehicles.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Retrieves basic OBD‑II trouble codes.
Tests sensors and actuators with multimeters and scopes.
Interprets live‑data streams and service bulletins to pinpoint issues.
Diagnoses multiplex CAN‑bus and advanced driver‑assist systems.
Develops diagnostic procedures and trains technicians fleet‑wide.

label: Mechanical Systems Diagnosis
description: Troubleshoots engines, gear trains, or motors to restore optimal performance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies simple wear or leak symptoms.
Uses manuals and basic tools to replace common parts.
Applies systematic fault‑tree analysis to multi‑component systems.
Performs full overhauls and calibrations for efficiency.
Engineers performance upgrades and trains maintenance teams.

label: Electric Vehicle Systems Basics
description: Understands high‑voltage safety, battery management, and electric drivetrains in hybrid or full‑electric vehicles.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Performs visual inspections and follows HV lock‑out procedures.
Uses diagnostic software to read battery SOC and fault codes.
Replaces battery modules and services power electronics cooling.
Analyzes battery degradation data and optimizes charge profiles.
Designs EV maintenance programs and consults on fleet electrification.

label: Welding Processes Mastery
description: Executes MIG, TIG, and Stick welding procedures across varied materials and thicknesses.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Welds basic joints on mild steel.
Selects filler metal and gas for routine jobs.
Performs multi‑pass welds on stainless and aluminum.
Customizes welding parameters for structural integrity and aesthetics.
Certifies processes, writes WPS documents, and mentors welders.

label: Preventive Maintenance Systems
description: Designs schedules, checklists, and data‑driven practices to prolong equipment lifespan and minimize downtime.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows manufacturer maintenance intervals.
Logs maintenance actions and parts replacements.
Uses condition‑based monitoring to trigger service.
Implements CMMS software and analyzes MTBF metrics.
Automates predictive maintenance using IIoT sensors and AI analytics.

label: Metal Cutting Techniques
description: Safely and precisely cuts metals using oxy‑fuel, plasma, abrasive saws, and shears.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Performs straight cuts on mild steel with supervision.
Sets correct torch pressures and blade speeds.
Executes bevels and compound angles per drawing.
Programs CNC plasma tables for precision shapes.
Optimizes nesting and cutting parameters for material yield and quality.

label: Material Properties Knowledge
description: Identifies strength, hardness, corrosion resistance, and heat‑treatment needs of metals, plastics, and composites to select optimal materials.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recalls basic tensile strengths of common steels and alloys.
Chooses material type for straightforward load scenarios.
Advises on substitutions based on cost, availability, or sustainability.
Calculates fatigue life and joins dissimilar materials securely.
Engineers custom material specs and inspection regimes for critical applications.

label: Construction 3D Printing Basics
description: Operates and maintains large‑format additive‑manufacturing systems for building components or small structures.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Preps basic G‑code and monitors single‑wall prints.
Mixes print media and calibrates extruder settings.
Troubleshoots layer adhesion and dimensional accuracy issues.
Customizes design files for structural performance and material savings.
Integrates 3‑D printing into hybrid prefab workflows and develops QA standards.

label: CNC Machine Operation
description: Operates and programs computer‑numerical‑control milling, turning, or cutting machines for precision part production.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Loads basic G‑code and monitors a single setup.
Selects tooling and sets work offsets for routine jobs.
Writes or edits CAM programs to improve cycle time.
Conducts preventative maintenance and precision alignment.
Optimizes multi‑axis workflows and trains machinists.

label: Water Conservation Systems
description: Installs and maintains systems that minimize potable‑water use, including gray‑water reuse and high‑efficiency fixtures.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Installs EPA WaterSense fixtures.
Configures rain‑barrel or cistern collection for irrigation.
Designs gray‑water plumbing loops and treatment units.
Integrates water‑reuse strategies into building management systems.
Engineers district‑scale water‑conservation programs and sets policy.

label: Solar System Installation Basics
description: Installs rooftop or ground‑mount photovoltaic arrays in compliance with electrical and structural codes.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Mounts panels and connects DC wiring under supervision.
Calculates string voltage, current, and inverter sizing.
Performs full system layout including racking, grounding, and monitoring.
Optimizes production via shading analysis and micro‑inverter selection.
Designs utility‑scale PV systems and trains installers.

label: Green Building Principles
description: Applies energy‑efficient and sustainable building practices to reduce environmental impact.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Chooses eco‑friendly materials where available.
Implements simple waste‑reduction and recycling on site.
Calculates insulation R‑values and daylighting requirements.
Guides projects through LEED or equivalent certification.
Designs net‑zero or regenerative building strategies across portfolios.

label: Client Communication Skills
description: Explains technical concepts to customers, sets expectations, and ensures satisfaction during service or installation work.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Conveys basic information and answers common questions politely.
Uses layman’s terms to explain work scope, cost, and timing.
Handles complaints, negotiates small change orders, and documents agreements.
Builds trust that drives referrals and upsells value‑added services.
Designs customer‑experience standards and trains field teams to exceed them.

label: Trade Project Management
description: Plans and oversees trade‑based projects including budgeting, scheduling, and workforce coordination.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Tracks task completion on simple jobs.
Creates timelines and procures materials for small projects.
Manages subcontractors, change orders, and inspections.
Controls cost, quality, and safety across multi‑phase builds.
Leads complex capital projects and continuous‑improvement programs.

label: HVAC Thermal Systems Basics
description: Applies core principles of heating, cooling, and airflow to install and service HVAC systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes major HVAC components and safety procedures.
Installs split‑system units with checklist guidance.
Calculates basic heat‑load and airflow requirements.
Balances multi‑zone systems and optimizes duct design.
Engineers load‑balanced HVAC plans for large facilities.

label: Structural Framing
description: Constructs walls, roofs, and floors to meet structural specifications and building codes.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Assists in cutting and nailing dimensional lumber to plans.
Squares walls and installs basic trusses.
Reads engineered drawings and installs engineered lumber products.
Oversees multi‑story framing, bracing, and inspections.
Manages structural framing across large commercial sites and trains framing crews.

label: Smart Home Integration
description: Installs and configures connected thermostats, lighting, security, and voice‑control devices into cohesive residential systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Installs basic plug‑and‑play devices.
Configures mobile apps and simple routines.
Integrates multi‑vendor devices via hubs and protocols.
Designs full smart‑home ecosystems with network security best practices.
Architects scalable automation frameworks and consults on smart‑building codes.

label: Safety System Design
description: Engineers processes and controls that maximize worker safety in high‑risk environments.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows established safety procedures and lockout‑tagout.
Conducts hazard assessments and drafts safe‑work plans.
Designs engineered safeguards and emergency response protocols.
Implements safety‑management systems and tracks KPIs.
Architects safety‑first culture and drives incident rates toward zero.

label: Refrigeration Cycle Mastery
description: Understands, analyzes, and optimizes vapor‑compression refrigeration cycles for commercial systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Names the four major components and their functions.
Uses pressure‑temperature charts to verify correct subcooling.
Diagnoses superheat problems and refrigerant migration.
Retrofits systems for alternative refrigerants and improved COP.
Designs high‑efficiency refrigeration layouts for industrial facilities.

label: Pipefitting Techniques
description: Measures, cuts, and assembles piping for fluids or gas with leak‑free tolerances.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Cuts and threads pipe under supervision.
Follows schematic to route simple piping systems.
Uses precision instruments to ensure proper slope and alignment.
Coordinates multiple pipe trades and pressure tests systems.
Designs and oversees full industrial piping layouts.

label: OSHA Compliance Awareness
description: Understands and applies Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations to daily construction and trade practices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common job‑site hazards and required PPE.
Completes Job Safety Analysis (JSA) forms and reports near‑misses.
Conducts toolbox talks and enforces housekeeping standards.
Audits projects for compliance and recommends corrective actions.
Develops enterprise safety programs and liaises with regulatory bodies.

label: HVAC System Troubleshooting
description: Diagnoses and repairs HVAC unit faults, sensor failures, and airflow issues to restore efficiency.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Replaces filters and belts; observes common fault codes.
Uses gauges to check refrigerant pressures and adjusts charge.
Interprets sensor data to identify airflow or control issues.
Performs energy‑consumption analyses and retro‑commissioning.
Designs predictive‑maintenance programs and trains techs org‑wide.

label: Electrical Code Compliance
description: Applies national and local electrical codes when installing or servicing systems to ensure safety and legality.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Consults codebook for conductor ampacity and box fill.
Documents installations for inspector approval.
Designs branch circuits and grounding schemes to code.
Interprets complex requirements (haz‑loc, arc‑flash) and trains staff.
Writes compliance policies and liaises with AHJs on large projects.

label: Drainage System Design
description: Designs and maintains wastewater or storm‑water drainage systems that meet code and environmental standards.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Installs standard drains with correct slope.
Calculates pipe sizing for small systems.
Applies backflow prevention and venting requirements.
Plans municipal or campus‑scale drainage with hydraulic modeling.
Engineers urban drainage infrastructure integrating green‑stormwater solutions.

label: Blueprint Interpretation
description: Reads and accurately applies architectural, structural, or mechanical drawings to guide field work.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic symbols and legends on drawings.
Locates dimensions and materials to complete simple tasks.
Cross‑references multiple sheets to execute multi‑trade details.
Verifies tolerances and anticipates clashes, guiding small crews.
Leads complex builds directly from BIM/3‑D models, resolving conflicts in real time.

label: Basic Electrical Wiring
description: Installs, troubleshoots, and services residential or light‑commercial branch‑circuit wiring in accordance with code.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Pulls NM cable and terminates receptacles under supervision.
Sizes breakers and wire gauges for common loads.
Diagnoses open‑neutral, overload, and GFCI faults.
Designs sub‑panel layouts and calculates load balancing.
Oversees multi‑panel installations and mentors apprentices.

label: Sleep Hygiene
description: Implements routines and environment for restorative sleep.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Tracks bedtime variability.
Maintains consistent sleep/wake schedule.
Optimizes environment (light, temperature).
Uses data (wearables) to refine sleep cycles.
Advocates organization‑wide sleep‑positive practices.

label: Recovery Micro‑Habits
description: Inserts short recovery actions (stretch, breath, micro‑meditation) throughout the day.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Performs occasional micro‑breaks.
Schedules breaks every 90–120 minutes.
Uses varied micro‑recovery techniques.
Tracks recovery metrics (HRV or mood).
Designs systemic micro‑recovery culture.

label: Optimism with Realism
description: Maintains positive expectancy while acknowledging constraints.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Uses encouraging self‑talk.
Balances optimism with risk assessment.
Applies realistic optimism to planning.
Coaches teams in balanced explanatory styles.
Embeds realistic‑optimism frameworks into strategy.

label: Growth Mindset
description: Believes abilities can develop through effort and feedback.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Accepts the basic idea.
Embraces challenges instead of avoidance.
Seeks feedback proactively.
Turns failures into learning roadmaps.
Builds growth‑mindset culture in teams and organizations.

label: Burnout Prevention Practices
description: Recognizes fatigue signals and protects boundaries to sustain engagement.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges signs of overload.
Implements weekly rest and boundary setting.
Monitors workload metrics and recovery.
Advocates workload redistribution or structural fixes.
Designs organization‑level burnout‑mitigation programs.

label: Social Responsibility Awareness
description: Considers societal and environmental impacts of personal choices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges personal footprint.
Makes small lifestyle adjustments (recycling, volunteering).
Regularly factors social impact into decisions.
Advocates for social responsibility in communities.
Integrates social‑impact metrics into ventures and policy.

label: Moral Courage
description: Acts ethically despite potential negative consequences.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Speaks up on minor issues.
Reports wrongdoing through proper channels.
Takes principled stands in difficult meetings.
Leads ethical reform efforts.
Protects whistle‑blowers and institutionalizes moral‑courage culture.

label: Integrity Alignment
description: Aligns daily actions with proclaimed values.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices misalignments after the fact.
Avoids actions conflicting with values.
Proactively chooses value‑aligned options.
Upholds values under pressure.
Sets integrity standards and models unwavering consistency.

label: Ethical Reflection & Reasoning
description: Applies ethical frameworks (utilitarian, duty, virtue) to dilemmas.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes ethical elements in decisions.
Uses one framework such as fairness.
Compares multiple frameworks for complex dilemmas.
Facilitates group ethical decision‑making sessions.
Develops systemic ethical‑reasoning curricula.

label: Stress‑Recovery Protocols
description: Applies evidence‑based techniques to return to baseline quickly.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes physical signs of stress.
Practices box‑breathing or short walks to reset.
Maintains daily recovery rituals (sleep, active rest).
Teaches stress‑recovery to others; tracks HRV or analogous metrics.
Embeds multi‑layer recovery systems in organizational culture.

label: Impulse Control
description: Delays gratification and modulates automatic responses.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Pauses briefly before reactive actions.
Uses a 10‑second rule to curb minor impulses.
Implements environmental design to reduce temptations.
Maintains composure under high stakes.
Coaches teams in impulse‑control practices during crises.

label: Emotion Regulation Strategies
description: Reappraises, accepts, or channels emotions constructively.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies emotion after trigger.
Uses re‑framing to reduce intensity.
Chooses appropriate regulation method for context.
Coaches peers in adaptive regulation under stress.
Designs programs fostering organization‑wide emotional agility.

label: Attention Switching & Focus
description: Shifts and sustains focus deliberately between tasks or stimuli.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices distraction after it happens.
Uses timers to focus for 25‑minute intervals.
Schedules cognitive blocks by task type.
Maintains deep focus 90+ minutes; transitions smoothly.
Optimizes team focus architecture (communication protocols, no‑meeting zones).

label: Sensory Mindfulness
description: Maintains present‑moment attention to sensory input without judgment.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Practices 1‑minute breathing pauses.
Conducts short body‑scan meditations.
Holds mindful awareness during routine tasks.
Guides group mindfulness sessions.
Integrates mindfulness into organizational routines and policies.

label: Self‑Reflective Insight
description: Accurately perceives internal states, motives, and thought patterns.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices emotions and recurring thoughts.
Records reflections (journals, apps) after events.
Identifies patterns influencing behavior and decisions.
Adjusts mindsets in real time to improve outcomes.
Teaches structured self‑reflection methods to others.

label: Personal Values Clarification
description: Articulates core values that guide choices and priorities.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists top personal values after reflection.
Ranks values and notes conflicts.
Uses values to choose between competing options.
Aligns long‑term goals and daily habits with values.
Facilitates values‑clarification programs for others.

label: Metacognition Skills
description: Thinks about and regulates one’s own thinking to improve learning and strategy.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices thinking traps after results.
Plans work using simple metacognitive questions (What? Why? How?).
Monitors comprehension in real time; adapts strategy mid‑task.
Coaches others in metacognitive techniques and measures learning ROI.
Designs systemic meta‑learning routines driving adaptive organizations.

label: Identity & Self‑Authorship
description: Constructs a self‑concept not dictated by external validation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Questions externally imposed identity scripts.
Articulates personal narrative distinct from external approval.
Makes choices aligned with self‑authored identity despite pressure.
Guides major life pivots through self‑authorship and mentors others.
Models integrated, self‑authored living that inspires systemic authenticity.

label: Emotional Labeling
description: Identifies and names nuanced emotional states in self.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Distinguishes basic feelings (happy, sad, angry).
Uses emotion vocabulary to label personal states.
Recognizes mixed or layered emotions in real time.
Coaches peers in precise emotional articulation.
Designs curricula that build emotional‑granularity culture‑wide.

label: Cognitive Bias Spotting
description: Detects personal heuristics and biases affecting judgment.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Learns definitions of common biases.
Retrospectively identifies biased decisions.
Uses checklists to reduce bias in current tasks.
Facilitates bias‑reduction workshops for teams.
Builds organization‑wide systems for bias auditing.

label: Purpose Articulation
description: Connects daily actions to a personally meaningful mission.

proficiency_levels.indicator: States a rough personal mission.
Links weekly goals to mission.
Evaluates opportunities through purpose lens.
Aligns career/life roadmap with mission.
Inspires others to craft and live their purpose.

label: Mastery‑Oriented Goal Setting
description: Sets learning goals emphasizing skill improvement over ego validation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Sets general outcome goals.
Defines SMART mastery goals.
Tracks progress via deliberate practice metrics.
Iterates goals based on performance data and feedback.
Coaches organizations in mastery‑goal cultures.

label: Healthy Autonomy Orientation
description: Chooses tasks and environments supporting self‑directed growth.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes need for choice.
Requests autonomy within role boundaries.
Negotiates work models that boost intrinsic motivation.
Designs self‑managed projects.
Establishes autonomy‑supportive culture for teams and organizations.

label: Grit & Persistence
description: Sustains effort over long horizons despite setbacks.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Completes short tasks.
Finishes multi‑week projects.
Maintains progress on multi‑month objectives.
Recovers quickly from major setbacks; keeps vision.
Leads others through multi‑year missions; builds collective perseverance.

label: Personal Kanban Flow
description: Visualizes and limits work‑in‑progress to manage personal throughput.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Uses basic to‑do list.
Creates a simple "To Do / Doing / Done" board.
Limits WIP and measures lead time.
Continuously improves flow and eliminates bottlenecks.
Coaches Kanban systems for teams and cross‑functional programs.

label: Habit Loop Design
description: Engineers cue‑routine‑reward loops to automate desired behaviors.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies existing habit loops.
Creates simple cue‑action‑reward for one habit.
Stacks habit loops to form routines.
Optimizes context triggers to maintain habits under stress.
Coaches groups in scalable habit‑installation systems.

label: Energy Management
description: Aligns tasks with natural energy rhythms and recovery practices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Tracks energy highs and lows.
Schedules demanding tasks in high‑energy windows.
Uses nutrition, movement, and rest to influence energy curve.
Designs quarterly energy‑recharge cycles.
Creates organization‑level energy‑management policies.

label: Digital Minimalism
description: Curates digital tools and inputs to reduce cognitive load.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Audits notifications occasionally.
Disables nonessential alerts.
Establishes tech‑use boundaries (email windows).
Periodically declutters apps and platforms.
Models and teaches digital‑minimalist principles organization‑wide.

label: Deep‑Work Practice
description: Eliminates distraction for cognitively intense sessions.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Tries short distraction‑free blocks.
Schedules regular 60‑minute deep‑work periods.
Achieves 90–120 minute sustained focus with clear outputs.
Integrates deep‑work rhythms across teams.
Cultivates culture where deep work is protected norm.

label: Vision‑Setting
description: Crafts and communicates a compelling picture of the future, aligning people and resources toward that vision.

proficiency_levels.indicator: States team goals and basic aspirations.
Links near‑term tasks to a clear medium‑term vision.
Articulates multi‑year vision and secures stakeholder sponsorship.
Inspires cross‑functional teams to act on a shared long‑term direction.
Orchestrates enterprise‑wide vision that shapes markets and culture.

label: Systems Thinking for Leaders
description: Understands organizations as dynamic systems and designs interventions that optimize the whole.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes feedback loops and interdependencies.
Maps causal links to anticipate second‑order effects.
Designs interventions that optimise the whole system, not just parts.
Aligns structures, processes, and culture to systemic insights.
Builds adaptive, learning systems that sustain strategic advantage.

label: Strategic Thinking
description: Synthesizes data and insights to chart long‑range direction that balances opportunity and risk.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes how routine work supports objectives.
Performs simple SWOT or PESTLE analyses.
Transforms market data into actionable plans.
Builds multi‑horizon roadmaps balancing risk and opportunity.
Shapes industry positioning through scenario planning and portfolio shifts.

label: Strategic Communication
description: Crafts and delivers messages that align, motivate, and drive coordinated action.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Conveys direction with clarity and consistency.
Tailors messages to audience needs and channels.
Aligns narrative to strategy and culture.
Orchestrates multi‑channel campaigns that mobilize action.
Engineers organizational alignment through narrative architecture and storytelling.

label: Stakeholder Coalition Building
description: Identifies, aligns, and mobilizes diverse stakeholders toward shared objectives.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists primary stakeholders and concerns.
Communicates project value to gain support.
Negotiates trade‑offs among diverse interests.
Builds multi‑party coalitions that champion change initiatives.
Orchestrates broad networks sustaining long‑term strategic alliances.

label: Situational Leadership
description: Adapts leadership style to follower readiness and situational demands.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Adjusts tone and guidance to follower readiness.
Selects directing/coaching/supporting/delegating style per situation.
Diagnoses development level and adapts quickly under pressure.
Coaches peers in situational‑style agility.
Designs leadership‑pipeline programs grounded in style flexibility.

label: Risk‑Aware Leadership
description: Integrates risk identification, mitigation, and appetite into decision‑making and strategy.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies obvious operational risks.
Records and tracks project risks and mitigations.
Conducts scenario and sensitivity analyses.
Integrates risk appetite into strategic planning.
Embeds enterprise risk‑management systems and culture.

label: Remote & Hybrid Team Leadership
description: Leads distributed teams effectively, ensuring engagement, accountability, and culture cohesion.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Schedules virtual meetings with clear agendas.
Uses digital tools to track commitments and progress.
Establishes norms that support engagement and psychological safety.
Optimizes asynchronous workflows for diverse time zones.
Engineers scalable remote‑work strategy integrated with culture.

label: Mentoring & Coaching
description: Develops others by providing feedback, guidance, and growth opportunities.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Shares knowledge informally.
Provides constructive feedback.
Sets learning goals and uses coaching questions.
Establishes structured mentoring programs and measures impact.
Builds an enterprise coaching culture aligned to strategy.

label: Innovation Leadership
description: Fosters a culture where novel ideas are generated, tested, and scaled for advantage.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Encourages sharing of new ideas.
Allocates time for small experiments.
Funds pilot projects and measures learning.
Builds innovation pipelines with portfolio management.
Shapes a culture where experimentation drives strategic advantage.

label: Influence Without Authority
description: Motivates and secures commitment from individuals or groups over whom one has no formal control.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Gains informal cooperation on simple tasks.
Builds credibility and rapport across functions.
Negotiates resources and commitment without direct power.
Mobilizes cross‑boundary coalitions for strategic initiatives.
Orchestrates enterprise change leveraging networks over hierarchy.

label: Inclusive Leadership
description: Creates an environment where all individuals feel respected, valued, and able to contribute.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Values different perspectives and avoids biased language.
Ensures all voices are heard in meetings.
Removes systemic barriers and adapts communication for diverse groups.
Champions inclusive policies and equity metrics.
Embeds inclusion into strategy, brand, and talent pipelines.

label: Ethical Governance
description: Ensures decisions and behaviours align with legal, moral, and societal expectations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows code of conduct.
Identifies ethical dilemmas and seeks guidance.
Weighs stakeholder impacts and mitigates conflicts of interest.
Champions ethical decision frameworks across teams.
Engineers organization‑wide ethics programs and public accountability processes.

label: Delegation Mastery
description: Assigns responsibility and authority to others at the right level to build capacity and achieve results.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Hands off straightforward tasks with supervision.
Matches task complexity to capability.
Coordinates distributed ownership of deliverables.
Delegates stretch assignments to accelerate growth.
Designs scalable delegation systems that build capacity organization‑wide.

label: Decision‑Making & Judgment
description: Applies structured thinking and ethical reasoning to choose the best course of action.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Seeks relevant data before deciding on routine issues.
Chooses among options using defined criteria.
Balances analytical evidence with stakeholder input.
Makes high‑stakes decisions under uncertainty with transparent rationale.
Sets enterprise decision frameworks integrating risk appetite and strategy.

label: Crisis Leadership
description: Leads under extreme volatility, ambiguity, and pressure while preserving mission and people.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Stabilizes immediate safety and communication.
Implements contingency plans and allocates critical resources.
Leads teams under pressure, balancing mission and people care.
Builds antifragile cultures that learn and improve through crises.
Anticipates, prepares for, and exploits disruptions, strengthening institutional resilience.

label: Conflict Resolution
description: Navigates disagreements to arrive at constructive, sustainable solutions.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes tension and listens actively.
Uses neutral language to ease minor disputes.
Facilitates discussions to reach mutually acceptable solutions.
Mediates complex, high‑stakes conflicts.
Designs conflict‑management systems and trains mediators.

label: Change Leadership
description: Guides individuals and organizations through transitions, uncertainty, and reinvention.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains rationale for change initiatives.
Uses simple change‑management tools.
Develops change plans and monitors adoption metrics.
Leads enterprise transformations with multi‑stakeholder alignment.
Establishes sustainable change capability embedded in culture.

label: Self‑Motivation
description: Initiates and sustains actions without external encouragement; driven to achieve personal and organizational goals.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Completes tasks when assigned.
Seeks opportunities to improve and contribute.
Sets and pursues own performance goals.
Models proactive behavior that inspires others.
Establishes systems and culture for intrinsic motivation and excellence.

label: Resilience
description: Demonstrates the ability to recover from setbacks, adversity, or pressure.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges stress but maintains basic functioning.
Returns to baseline performance after minor challenges.
Handles sustained pressure while meeting responsibilities.
Develops support strategies for personal and team resilience.
Implements resilience programming at the organizational level.

label: Learning Agility
description: Quickly acquires and applies new knowledge and skills in evolving contexts.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes the need for learning new skills.
Seeks learning opportunities and applies them.
Adapts learning strategies to various contexts.
Teaches others and applies insights across domains.
Drives organizational learning and adaptive strategy.

label: Emotional Intelligence
description: Recognizes, understands, and manages one’s own emotions and the emotions of others.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges personal feelings and observes emotions in others.
Manages responses and communicates feelings constructively.
Anticipates emotional triggers and adapts behaviour.
Navigates complex emotional dynamics in teams.
Fosters emotionally intelligent cultures and coaching models.

label: Critical Thinking
description: Analyzes facts to form judgments and solve problems effectively.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes when an issue needs deeper thought.
Identifies patterns and asks clarifying questions.
Applies structured reasoning to evaluate alternatives.
Develops decision frameworks for complex problems.
Shapes organizational strategy using rigorous analysis and logic.

label: Collaboration
description: Works cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and support group efforts.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Participates in group discussions and activities.
Shares information and supports team members.
Coordinates tasks and resolves minor conflicts.
Facilitates collaboration across departments or disciplines.
Designs and leads strategic cross‑functional collaboration initiatives.

label: Adaptability
description: Adjusts effectively to changing environments, tasks, and responsibilities.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices and accepts basic changes in routine.
Adjusts to minor shifts in process or environment.
Remains effective despite unexpected change.
Guides others through transitions while maintaining stability.
Champions adaptive culture and frameworks across functions.

label: Accountability
description: Takes responsibility for outcomes, actions, and decisions while upholding integrity.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges errors when pointed out.
Takes ownership of assigned tasks.
Accepts consequences and learns from mistakes.
Promotes a culture of accountability in teams.
Establishes accountability frameworks and ethical standards.
